This was released when I was 9 and I have somehow made it a whopping 14 years without knowing ANY spoilers for it. Lemme tell you - its fantastic. The gameplay, graphics, all of it still holds up. The slow reveal of the nature of the game sucks you in and keeps you wanting to learn more. 10/10, would recommend.

so good even tho it only takes an hour to beat still so worth

Portal is perhaps the best introduction to PC Gaming— nothing is very complex, it isn't very long, and it takes full advantage of the medium of video games.

Returning to this game, however, really highlights just how basic this game is, not that that is necessarily a bad thing. 

Puzzles are generally straightforward, there's a nice incremental learning curve, it's never stressful, and the story is nice and simple.  Music is pleasant, graphics definitely are showing a bit of age however.

A foundational PC game that should be played by basically anyone.

I hate coming back to this game, because of the repetitive 19 levels... ik it gives you easter eggs to keep you entertained

But yeah positive review because youre not really supposed to play this twice, unless you never found a secret

У людей есть выбор, Portal 1 или Portal 2. Обычно большинство людей выбирают первую часть, но это не про игры Valve. Игры от этой компании делают так: Игра выпускается, смотрят, понравилось ли людям, если понравилось, выпускают улучшенную вторую часть. Первая Portal была проходным проектом, понравится ли людям? Людям понравилось, и появилась вторая, лучшая в плане сюжета, актёров и геймплея игра. А про первую часть забыли, потому что, будем честны, она так себе. Особенно русский дубляж. Вывод: Я рекомендую игру к ознакомлению.

I hadn't really played any puzzle games ever, but the overwhelmingly positive reviews for this game made me purchase it, and I have to say I greatly enjoyed this.

Portal is a simple and short puzzle platform game where you have to complete a series of rooms, each one requiring you to do specific stuff while introducing new mechanics. I had always felt that puzzle games have an evident lack of action, but Portal levels were designed to not only require knowledge about the physics, but also speed (there are turrets that can kill you, some achievements, etc.). Its mechanics are rather simple: you are given a gun capable of shooting two portals, which you can travel through to get into seemingly impossible places otherwise. However, it feels quite smooth, yet increasingly confusing as you progress through the rooms.

In addition, the aesthetics are rather simplistic as well, and while they definitely feel a bit outdated (considering the game was released in 2007), they do their job well and avoid unnecessary decoration. This also makes the game run smoothly on all sorts of devices, meaning you don't have to worry about FPS at all.

Lastly, Valve combined these aspects with an uncomplicated sense of dark humour, great sound design, a nice story and some cool secrets scattered across the levels.

The only somewhat negative aspect I can think of is the briefness of the game in general, but I would totally recommend it to everyone anyways.

You should definitely get Portal. Although old, it looks better than some games coming out even today.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
As the name suggests, you create portals for solving puzzles and getting over obstacles. Since only two are present at a time and on certain surfaces, it limits our options and we need to think of a clever solution. Here, their combination with physics comes in handy. For example, using the momentum built while falling to leap vertically or even horizontally, thus getting from one place to another. 

[h1] Campaign [/h1]
The campaign itself is not that long. You can finish it in 2-3 hours, but there are bonus maps and achievements which take another 15-20 hours to complete. Although short, it does feature an interesting story. You get to meet GLaDOS - an artificial intelligence computer that serves as our narrator with her funny dialog. As the game progresses, you understand that something deep is behind the plot and it continues in the sequel.

[quote] My advice is to buy Portal 1 on sale before playing Portal 2  [/quote]

If you liked my review, check [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/yankoro223/recommended/] other reviews[/url] in my profile or follow my page: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42670199-Lisko-reviews/] Lisko Reviews[/url]

Portal – gra legenda, zaraz za Half Lifem [u]drugie złote dziecko Valve[/u], a jednak. Niewiem czy na 2007 rok niecałe [h1]4 godziny[/h1] grania są super hiper długie ale, mnie deko rozczarował czas jej przechodzenia. Historia znana tak bardzo jak pewnie sławny gość o wielu zawodach [b][i]m.in. astronauty, lekarza, hydraulika, policjant, strażak, nauczyciel i ksiądz.[/i][/b] Łamigłówki fajne, znaczy jest o czym pomyśleć, tak żeby się nie namyśleć. Ogólnie polecam dla wszystkich którzy mają, [strike]chcą coś spokojnego na niedzielne granie,[/strike] które pójdzie na drewnie.

Wow y simplemente wow.
Sinceramente no le tenía fé a este juego ya que una vez lo jugué por 2019 en la casa de un amigo y no me había convencido. Ahora que me dí la oportunidad de probarlo me han cerrado la jeta. Es un juegazo. Tanto por sus mecánicas de utilizar portales, historia y su lado cómico. Lo único malo es su duración. Me lo pasé en 4 horas nada más. Obviamente para los speedruners es un montón, pero no me ví guías ni nada para terminarlo.
Me gusta el hecho de que pueda coexistir con el universo de Half Life, creo que le aporta bastante a la historia y la hace más interesante.

Mi puntuación es 9,5/10

Siendo un amador de los juegos de puzles, Portal sin duda es uno de mis favoritos, lo conocí principalmente por mi hermano con quien jugamos juntos al dos, así que jugar al primer juego ha sido una verdadera diversión ¿Por qué deberías jugarlo?

Por sus puzles: no se requiere reflejos, solo es cuestión de lógica, son bastantes simples, si lo quieres disfrutar ¡Tomate tu tiempo! Generalmente resuelvo cada sala a la vez, de ese modo tengo la mente fresca para los siguientes acertijos.

Por su jugabilidad: Créeme que es bastante simple, solo basta con usar la pistola de portales, saltar y agallarse para resolver los distintos puzles y llegar a la otra sala.

Por ser ingenioso: Se nos presentan varias salas que aumentan en dificultad, esto sin caer en la repetición, eso es lo más divertido.

Por su IA: Si, en toda la partida nos acompaña una voz que nos habla de una forma divertida e irónica, no es cansador escucharlo, es más, como que quieres saber lo próximo que te dirá, como por ejemplo este comentario: "Tome en cuenta que nuestras pruebas parecen letales solo para que se divierta más" jajaja me parece tierno.

Nota: No espere mucho de las gráficas, no son la gran cosa.
